mill.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a building containing a large machine for crushing grain into flour
mill.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a factory that produces materials such as cotton, cloth, or steel
mill.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a unit of money equal to 1/10 of a cent, used in setting taxes and for other financial purposes
mill.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Are you saying they paid a quarter of a mill for that house?
mill.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to crush grain, pepper etc in a mill
mill.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: All our flours are milled using traditional methods.
Add some freshly milled black pepper.
mill.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to press, roll, or shape metal in a machine
mill.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a building containing a large machine for crushing grain into flour, or the machine itself
mill.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a factory that produces a material such as cotton, cloth, or steel
mill.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The textile mill is full of modern Japanese machinery.
the growing of conifers for the paper mills
mill.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to produce flour by crushing grain in a mill
mill.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to press, roll, or shape metal in a machine
mill.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: to mark the edge of a coin with regular lines
